articles.description: The employer may treat it as leave without pay if an employee refuses to work from home, says legal expert.
articles.content:
Companies cannot force employees to take leave without pay amid the 21-day lockdown imposed by the government to control to the spread of COVID-19, according to experts.
In general, annual leave is a statutory entitlement to be availed at the employees discr… [+1627 chars]

articles.author: Special Correspondent
articles.title: Coronavirus | Tantransco prepares for blackout on April 5
articles.description: All engineers have been asked to be present in headquarters between 8 p.m. and 10.30 p.m, with sufficient manpower, to monitor and take necessary action to maintain proper voltage levels.
articles.content: Anticipating a steep fall and subsequent rise in the lighting load on April 5 between 9 p.m and 9.09 p.m., when Prime Minister Narendra Modi has appealed to citizens to switch off lights, the Tamil Nadu Transmission Corporation (Tantransco) is gearing up to e… [+699 chars]

articles.author: PTI
articles.title: OUP India offers free online access to its educational resources on coronavirus
articles.description: OUP’s academic journals website has launched a new free hub of over 2,500 research articles and online chapters relevant to coronavirus.
articles.content:
Oxford University Press (OUP) on Friday announced that it is offering free online access to its educational resources on coronavirus in order to assist researchers, medical professionals and others who are working to address the pandemic.
The worlds largest … [+2304 chars]

articles.author: PTI
articles.title: Coronavirus | 21 FIRs in Delhi’s Dwarka for home quarantine violations
articles.description: Strict enforcement of home quarantine guidelines in the district is being ensured through regular surveillance by way of physical verification and technical monitoring, a police official said
articles.content:
Twenty-one FIRs have been registered against people in Dwarka for flouting home quarantine rules, police said on Friday.
The violators have been booked under the relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Section 3 of Epidemic Diseases Act, they said… [+279 chars]

articles.author: Jacob Koshy
articles.title: Coronavirus lockdown lifts Delhi’s March air quality to 5-year high
articles.description: CPCB data shows pollution fell nationwide with cities recording ‘good’ air quality rising to 30, from 6
articles.content: The ongoing lockdown due to COVID-19 pandemic has pushed pollution levels in Delhi to a 5-year low and, across India, the number of cities that recorded good on the air quality index jumped from 6 on March 16 to 30 as on March 29, according to data from the C… [+2567 chars]
